node.title: Departmental activity for the COVID19 times
node.summary: Join us for music and stories

node.title: New paper about sunflower clonal regenaration by tissue culture
node.summary: Our paper on an endangered sunflower tissue culture was accepted to MDPI Plants.

node.title: New paper about barley germination
node.summary: Our barley germination paper highlights the physiological background of barley seed reaction to drought.

node.title: Evaluation of genetic diversity of Asian callery pear
node.summary: In this endeavor, Shiwani (MS student) is evaluating species diversity using de novo gSSRs. We accrued samples of non-cultivated P. calleryana from Asia. Molecular markers will be tested for cross-amplification to related species as well.

node.title: Eastern Redbud chlorotyping and diversity assessment
node.summary: Chloroplast DNA haplotying of redbuds is expected to provide lineage and spread data, inaccessible with nuclear DNA SSRs.

node.title: Diversity of Eastern Redbud, Cercis canadensis, native to US
node.summary: MS thesis project of Meher A. Ony. Includes two major objectives, (1) gSSR selection and redbud fine-scale study, and (2) genetic diversity assessment across the species native range.

node.title: In vitro propagation of an endangered Helianthus verticillatus by axillary bud proliferation
node.summary: Simple tissue culture protocol for clonal multiplication of an endangered sunflower.

node.title: Influence of SDHI seed treatment on the physiological conditions of spring barley seedlings under drought stress
node.summary: Collaborative paper with Poznan University of Life Sciences (Poland).

node.title: The effect of habitat fragmentation on genetic diversity and differentiation; fine-scale population structure of Cercis canadensis (Eastern Redbud)
node.summary: Fine-scale genetic diversity study of Eastern redbud indicates two distinct genetic clusters in the Southern Appalachia.
